00014 #ifndef ULIB_RPC_GENERIC_METHOD_H
00015 #define ULIB_RPC_GENERIC_METHOD_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/command.h>
00018 #include <ulib/net/rpc/rpc_method.h>
00019 
00020 class U_EXPORT URPCGenericMethod : public URPCMethod {
00021 public:
00022 
00023         static UString* str_command_fault;
00024         static UString* str_command_not_started;
00025 
00026         static void str_allocate();
00027 
00028         // COSTRUTTORI
00029 
00030         URPCGenericMethod(const UString& n, UCommand* cmd, int rtype) : response_type(rtype), method_name(n), response(U_CAPACITY)
00031                 {
00032                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, URPCGenericMethod, "%.*S,%p,%d", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(n), cmd, rtype) 
00033 
00034                 command = cmd;
00035 
00036                 if (str_command_fault == 0) str_allocate();
00037                 }
00038 
00039         virtual ~URPCGenericMethod()
00040                 {
00041                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, URPCGenericMethod)
00042 
00043                 delete command;
00044                 }
00045 
00046         // VIRTUAL METHOD
00047 
00048         // Used to get the name of the method. This is matched up using the URPCObject dispatcher to respond to a call
00049 
00050         virtual UString getMethodName() const { return method_name; }
00051 
00052         // Transforms the method into something that servers and clients can send. The encoder holds the actual
00053         // data while the client hands data to be entered in. This makes a whole lot more sense in the samples that
00054         // should have shipped with the library
00055 
00056         virtual void encode()
00057                 {
00058                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCGenericMethod::encode()")
00059 
00060                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(URPCMethod::encoder)
00061 
00062                 U_RPC_ENCODE_RES((hasFailed() ? str_fault : str_done)->data(), response);
00063                 }
00064 
00065         // Only to be called on the server by the object dispatcher. This method executes the call and returns true
00066         // if the call succeeded, false if it failed. URPCGenericMethod should keep any return data in a member
00067         // variable. The information will be returned via a call to encode
00068 
00069         virtual bool execute(URPCEnvelope& theCall);
00070 
00071         // DEBUG
00072 
00073 #ifdef DEBUG
00074         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00075 #endif
00076 
00077 protected:
00078         UCommand* command;
00079         int response_type;
00080         UString method_name, response;
00081 
00082 private:
00083         URPCGenericMethod(const URPCGenericMethod& g) : URPCMethod() {}
00084         URPCGenericMethod& operator=(const URPCGenericMethod& g)                 { return *this; }
00085 };
00086 
00087 #endif
